docs.snippet: To listen to the Democratic and Republican presidential candidates describe the mass shootings in San Bernardino is to hear two separate realities. In one, the Democratic hopefuls speak repeatedly about gun control, a different reality than one de...
docs.abstract: To listen to the Democratic and Republican presidential candidates describe the mass shootings in San Bernardino is to hear two separate realities. In one, the Democratic hopefuls speak repeatedly about gun control, a different reality than one described by a number of Republican candidates.

headline.main: San Bernardino Shooting Divides Party Narratives

docs.lead_paragraph: Australia has had no killings of five or more since a 1996 rampage spurred a tightening of laws. Other forms of gun violence have fallen as well.

byline.contributor: Austin Ramzy and Patrick Boehler reported from Hong Kong, and Michelle Innis from Sydney, Australia.
byline.original: By AUSTIN RAMZY, MICHELLE INNIS and PATRICK BOEHLER

docs.snippet: Australia has had no killings of five or more since a 1996 rampage spurred a tightening of laws. Other forms of gun violence have fallen as well....
docs.abstract: Studies have shown that Australia's sweeping gun restrictions, enacted in 1996 after gunman massacred 35 people, have led to sharp reduction in gun violence; while Australia is frequently mentioned as example in United States for type of gun control legislation US should pursue, America has never tried national gun buyback program.

headline.print_headline: A Deterrent to Mass Killings in Australia
headline.main: How a Conservative-Led Australia Ended Mass Killings
